text: Moses Eugene Malone (March 23, 1955 â€“ September 13, 2015) was an American basketball player who played in both the American Basketball Association (ABA) and the National Basketball Association (NBA) from 1974 through 1995. He was a member of the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. Malone played for the Buffalo Braves (1976), the Houston Rockets (1976-1982), the Philadelphia 76ers (1982-1986; 1993-1994), the Washington Wizards (1986-1988), the Atlanta Hawks (1988-1991), the Milwaukee Bucks (1991-1993), and the San Antonio Spurs (1994-1995). He was a three-time NBA Most Valuable Player. Malone died suddenly from heart disease in Norfolk, Virginia at the age of 60. ==References== ==Other websites== * Malone's Biography on the official NBA site Category:1955 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Atlanta Hawks players Category:Houston Rockets players Category:Milwaukee Bucks players Category:Philadelphia 76ers players Category:San Antonio Spurs players Category:Sportspeople from Virginia Category:Washington Wizards players Category:National Basketball Association players with retired numbers
title: Moses Malone
